subject: Re: [junit] Re: Finding all the tests for a class?
msgSnippet: ... No, I use parallel package trees in different root directories. The only need to have groups is if you need to have one test belong to more than one
messageBody:
On 01/12/05, Cédric Beust ♔ <cbeust@...> wrote:
> Test groups to the rescue!
>
> So are you going to suggest to create packages "com.foo.fast" and "
> com.foo.slow" to simulate groups? :-)

No, I use parallel package trees in different root directories. The
only need to have groups is if you need to have one test belong to
more than one category, and I personally have yet to experience that
need.

--
"Software is too expensive to build cheaply"
Robert Watkins http://twasink.net/ robertdw@...
